links.title: Shareholder Communications
links.content:
# Shareholder Communications

There are new options available to SRL’s shareholders as to how you receive communications from the Company.

Receiving your shareholder communications electronically is the best way to stay informed and will assist SRL with its commitment to minimising paper usage.

If you haven’t already, we encourage you to make the switch to paperless communications and provide the Company’s share registry with your email address. The Company will no longer be sending physical meeting documents unless you request a copy to be posted.

The Company therefore encourages all shareholders to provide an email address so we can communicate with you electronically when shareholder notices (e.g. annual report or notice of meetings) become available online.

Shareholders can still elect to receive some or all of their communications in physical or electronic form, or elect not to receive certain documents such as annual reports. To review your communications preferences, or sign up to receive your shareholder communications via email, please update your details at <https://www.computershare.com/au>.

If you are a shareholder and would like a physical copy of a communication, need further information about the options available to you or have questions about your holding, visit <https://www.computershare.com/au> or contact the Share Registry:

_Address_

Computershare Investor Services Pty Limited

GPO Box 2975

Melbourne VIC 3001

Australia

_Phone (Business hours: Monday to Friday between 8.30am and 5.00pm)_

Within Australia: 1300 850 505

Outside Australia: +61 (0) 3 9415 4000

The Share Registry has also made available alternative means of communications for shareholders and these are available at [Contact us (computershare.com)](https://www.computershare.com/au/individuals/i-am-a-shareholder/contact-us)

links.title: Webcasts
links.content:
# Webcasts

**Benchmark Mineral Intelligence: Benchmark World Tour – Nickel**

CEO, Sam Riggall, presented at the **_Benchmark World Tour – Nickel_** virtual conference hosted by Benchmark Mineral Intelligence on 23 September 2020.

To watch the webcast of the presentation [**CLICK HERE**](https://vimeo.com/465318661)

**Battery Metals Day Webcast**

Sunrise Battery Materials Complex in NSW, Australia will be one of the world’s largest integrated producers of battery-grade nickel and cobalt sulphate. CEO, Sam Riggall, hosted the Battery Metals Day Webcast with other members of the management team to discuss battery materials market developments, present the highlights of the Sunrise Project Execution Plan and answer questions from attendees.

To watch the webcast [**CLICK HERE**](https://youtu.be/oxqJt27VH_4)
